p: The use of herbal medicines in Sokoto state has been documented for the management of diabetes ( Shinkafi et al., 2015) while for the treatment of malaria, peptic ulcer, and other ailments have been reported elsewhere ( Adebisi and Alebiosu, 2014; Oluranti et al., 2012a, 2012b). On the other hand, the use of medicinal plants for the treatment of cancer has received less attention and priority over the years due to the apparent focus on tropical and communicable diseases such as malaria, diabetes, polio meningitis, HIV/AIDS, etc. At the time of writing this report, there has not been any documented information on the use of folk medicine in relation to cancer treatment. This study was designed to explore and record various medicinal plants used as folk medicines for the treatment of cancer among the indigenous ethnic groups of Sokoto state.
